00045 #undef __CLASS__
00046 #define __CLASS__ "Viewport"
00047 
00048 class Window;
00049 
00050 /* 
00051   @brief A 2D rectangular drawing region
00052   @see Window
00053 */
00054 
00055 class Viewport : public Object {
00056  public:
00057  // Render the viewport and the scene
00058     void render();
00059  // Create a new instance of Viewport
00060     static Ptr<Viewport> Create() { return *new Viewport; }
00061 
00062     int width() { return _width; }              //< Return window width
00063     int height() { return _height; }    //< Return window height
00064  // Something
00065     void setSize( int x, int y, int width, int height ) {
00066       pos().x() = x;
00067       pos().y() = y;
00068       _width = width;
00069       _height = height;
00070     }
00071  // Return the scene associated with the viewport
00072     Ptr<Scene> scene() { return _scene; }
00073  // Assign a scene to the viewport
00074     void setScene( Ptr<Scene> scene ) { _scene = scene; }
00075  // Something
00076     void addWindow( Ptr<Window>& window ) {
00077         _windows.push_back( window );
00078     }
00079  // Add a sub-view to the viewport
00080     void addViewport( Ptr<Viewport> viewport ) { LOGI
00081         if( viewport.ptr() == this ) {
00082             cerr << "Can't add self as parent" << endl;
00083             return;
00084         }
00085         _viewports.push_back( viewport );
00086         viewport->_parent = Ptr<Viewport>(*this);
00087     LOGO }
00088 
00089  protected:
00090  // Hide the constructor
00091     Viewport() { }
00092  // Hide the destructor
00093     ~Viewport() { }
00094 
00095  private:
00096     int  _width, _height;
00097     Ptr<Scene>     _scene;      //< Pointer to scene
00098     Ptr<Viewport>  _parent;     //< Pointer to parent viewport
00099     list< Ptr<Window> >    _windows;
00100     list< Ptr<Viewport> >  _viewports;  //< List of subviews
00101 };
